result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ramone D Gladney not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Ramone D Gladney.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin.

Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (11 pages) commencing 07-28-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Ramone D Gladney in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-10-2022

Defendant Ramone D Gladney in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy Z Bruchman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.     
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ramone D Gladney in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.

Received and filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ramone D Gladney in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Ramone D Gladney in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ramone D Gladney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
